title:
$p$-adic $L$-function and Iwasawa Main Conjecture for an Artin motive
  over a CM field
abstract:
For an algebraic Hecke character defined on a CM field $F$ of degree $2d$,
Katz constructed a $p$-adic $L$-function of $d+1+\delta_{F,p}$ variables in his
innovative paper published in 1978, where $\delta_{F,p}$ denotes the Leopoldt
defect for $F$ and $p$. In the present article, we generalise the result of
Katz under several technical conditions (containing the absolute unramifiedness
of $F$ at $p$), and construct a $p$-adic Artin $L$-function of
$d+1+\delta_{F,p}$ variables, which interpolates critical values of the Artin
$L$-function associated to a $p$-unramified Artin representation of the
absolute Galois group $G_F$. Our construction is an analogue over a CM field of
Greenberg's construction over a totally real field, but there appear new
difficulties which do not matter in Greenberg's case.
